text:
Two years after they first listed it on the market, celebrity couple Tom Brady and Gisele Bündchen have finally managed to sell their One Madison apartment. The New York Observer was the first to report on the sale of the four bedroom home that’s located in the Flatiron District.

Bündchen and Brady first listed this apartment, which has sweeping NYC views, for $17.25 million, in 2016. The couple wasn’t able to find a buyer at that price, so earlier this year, they slashed the price on the condo to $13.95 million, and that seemed to do the trick. The couple had purchased the full-floor apartment back in 2014 for $11.7 million.

The new owner of their apartment can look forward to floor-to-ceiling windows, and 360 degree views of the city. Residents in the building also have access to amenities like an indoor pool, steam room, and fitness center.

Last year, Brady and Bündchen reportedly purchased a nearly $30 million home at the Robert A.M. Stern Architects-designed 70 Vestry, in Tribeca. Aside from that, the couple also owns homes in Massachusetts, Montana, and Costa Rica, according to the Observer.
title: Tom Brady and Gisele Bündchen finally sell their One Madison pad

meta_data.author: Tanay Warerkar
meta_data.description: The full-floor condo was last on the market for $13.95 million.
